definition: to refuse to accept, to reject as unauthorized or as having no binding force
to reject as untrue or unjust
to refuse to acknowledge or pay
to refuse to have anything to do with : disown
examples: … unless they repudiated the failed policies of the past and took decisive action, the party might fracture or lose its hold on the electorate.

definition: to divorce or separate formally from (a woman to whom one is betrothed or married)
examples: "The incident was witnessed by … the Marquess Zanipolo, who, in consequence, has already repudiated his unhappy bride."
